channel.title: Anti-xray
channel.description:
http://forums.bukkit.org/threads/sec-ore-to-client-obfuscation-v1-6-2-2-anti-x-ray-xray-1000-1060.26043/
Maybe try this? It had bugs in its early release but from what I can see 99.9% of them are now fixed.

item.title: Anti-xray
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Now it’s not so useless since it hides chests now, I might give it a try after we get everything back up and running.

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-xray
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

I don’t think letting people xray to find ores is that much of an issue. It is unfair, but it’s not like duping and still takes time etc. It would be nice to stop it, but we’d need to start a new map and keep the seed private this time. We’d also have to use the plugin to hide ores, and all the block updates probably wont help performance. Also, inb4 someone writes a script to get the seed based on visible blocks.

However, xraying to find buried chests is totally unfair and if we wanted to prevent this we wouldn’t have an issue with map seeds and unnecessary block updates. It might be a good idea to install this plugin and set it up to just hide chests.

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-xray
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:11, topic:410676”][quote author=carecarecare link=topic=511950.msg3715952#msg3715952 date=1313631133]
I have a mod that lets me download areas of multiplayer worlds anyways, so anyone could easily do that.
And MITB should add anti-cheat at least, which prevents flying by sending the player back to the ground.
[/quote]
If it lets you download the area, and the server sends a stone block instead of a chest (when appropriately covered) it won’t do you any good lol.[/quote]
Sure but he could still find the ores and I think that’s the main discussion here?

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-xray
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Yea, with seed generation instead of random, if the client knows the seed they could easily find ores.

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-xray
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

My point was basically that you can’t hide anything if it’s generated by the seed, no matter how much you mess around with shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-xray
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:6, topic:410676”][quote author=zuppers link=topic=511950.msg3715423#msg3715423 date=1313607993]

Would be a shame if someone wrote a mod that takes the servers seed and shows ores based on that. It wouldn’t even show ores that have already been mined because people don’t normally fill their mines back in with smooth stone.

Anyway, it would be a good short-term solution and it would also hide buried chests.
[/quote]Actually since xray is configurable you could set it up to render nothing but chest.

Either all ore blocks and chests that have no adjacent air, water, lava, or glass, or other transparent block block are sent to the client as stone blocks.

derp[/quote]Oh right. I was thinking of the old trick of covering chest with ores.

Read full topic

item.title: Anti-xray
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:

Would be a shame if someone wrote a mod that takes the servers seed and shows ores based on that. It wouldn’t even show ores that have already been mined because people don’t normally fill their mines back in with smooth stone.

Anyway, it would be a good short-term solution and it would also hide buried chests.
[/quote]Actually since xray is configurable you could set it up to render nothing but chest.[/quote]

Either all ore blocks and chests that have no adjacent air, water, lava, or glass, or other transparent block block are sent to the client as stone blocks.

derp

item.title: Anti-xray
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

To do this efficiently, part of the actual server code had to be modified. The download contains both a plugin, and a class file to patch a server jar with.
Would mitb do that tho?
